metadata.synopsis: Vampire Lord Astarion is at a party organised by Withers, six months after the ending of Baldur's Gate 3. He discusses the past few months with the avatar.

10.speaker: Astarion
10.text: And? Enjoying our little break from the Hells?
10.context: NodeContext: Next line: "I admit, I do miss the luxeries of this plane."

38.speaker: Player
38.text: It's so nice to see everyone!
38.context: NodeContext: Next line: "I admit, I do miss the luxeries of this plane."

140.speaker: Astarion
140.text: Savour it while you can, my love. Tomorrow the fun begins again.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: I wish we didn't have to go back.
11.context: NodeContext: Next line: "I admit, I do miss the luxeries of this plane."

300.speaker: Astarion
300.text: Really? We get to kill as much as we like, and consequences be damned.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Somewhat, but I'm itching to get back.
56.context: NodeContext: Next line: "I admit, I do miss the luxeries of this plane."

230.speaker: Astarion
230.text: An understandable urge. This place is dull by comparison, but...
230.context: NodeContext: Next line: "I admit, I do miss the luxeries of this plane."

134.speaker: Astarion
134.text: I admit, I do miss the luxuries of this plane. What I wouldn't give for a silk bed...

144.speaker: Astarion
144.text: But don't fear, we'll have that engine of yours fixed before you know it. And then we can return in all our glory.

35.speaker: Astarion
35.text: And? How have our dear friends been without us to guide and protect them?
35.context: NodeContext: Speaking to the player he's in a romance with

85.speaker: Player
85.text: They're great - everyone seems so happy.
85.context: NodeContext: Speaking to the player he's in a romance with

221.speaker: Astarion
221.text: Really? Are you sure? I was certain they'd be half-dead and begging us to take them back.
221.context: NodeContext: Speaking to the player he's in a romance with

65.speaker: Astarion
65.context: NodeContext: Speaking to the player he's in a romance with

215.speaker: Astarion
215.text: Still, it is good to see them. And good for them to see us, side by side, flourishing.
215.context: NodeContext: Speaking to the player he's in a romance with

186.speaker: Player
186.text: True. We are spectacular, after all.
186.context: NodeContext: Speaking to the player he's in a romance with

331.speaker: Astarion
331.text: We do turn every head the moment we walk into a room. And rightly so.

322.speaker: Player
322.text: It is wonderful. I'm glad I get to share this with you.
322.context: NodeContext: Speaking to the player he's in a romance with

320.speaker: Astarion
320.text: And I am blessed to share it with you, my love.
320.context: NodeContext: Speaking to the player he's in a romance with

197.speaker: Astarion
197.text: I may have power, but it would be nothing without you. You complete me.
197.context: NodeContext: Speaking to the player he's in a romance with

24.speaker: Astarion
24.text: And together, we are unstoppable. So Heavens help the fool that tries to get in our way.
24.context: NodeContext: Speaking to the player he's in a romance with

244.speaker: Player
244.text: Do you want to see the others? Say 'hello'?
244.context: NodeContext: Speaking to the player he's in a romance with

64.speaker: Astarion
64.text: No, I can see more than enough from here.

288.speaker: Player
288.text: I'll get back to the party. Do you want anything?
288.context: NodeContext: Speaking to the player he's in a romance with

62.speaker: Astarion
62.text: No, everything I want is standing right here.
62.context: NodeContext: Speaking to the player he's in a romance with

243.speaker: Astarion
243.text: But you should go - mingle, chat, laugh. Have fun, my love.

47.speaker: Astarion
47.text: And if our friends drop any interesting secrets, bring them right back to me.

208.speaker: Astarion
208.text: Until then, I'll be here. But don't fret, I will be watching. I am always watching.

285.speaker: Astarion
285.text: I almost wish they would. It's been some time since we've seen a real challenge.

242.speaker: Astarion
242.text: Of course, my darling. Look at us!

223.speaker: Astarion
223.text: We share a palace, share power, live lives eternal in each other's arms. What more could anyone want?

232.speaker: Astarion
232.text: I give you wealth, power, pleasure - every decadence that can be afforded to a person? But you'd rather - what - sleep in the dirt again?

30.speaker: Astarion
30.text: You are my consort, and I will see you living the very best life. Even if you don't appreciate it.

105.speaker: Astarion
105.text: Why don't you go and mingle? Have fun with your so-called friends. I'll be here when you're done.

247.speaker: Astarion
247.text: Really? I'm amazed they're doing as well as that - I was sure every one would be half-dead in the muck.

126.speaker: Astarion
126.text: Well of course they do! They were never anything without us leading them.

261.speaker: Astarion
261.text: I'm amazed they've even survived this long, honestly.

217.speaker: Astarion
217.text: Yes, well, that's to be expected. They never were anything without us.

4.speaker: Astarion
4.text: So how are you enjoying the Hells, my dear? I assume they're darling as ever?
4.context: NodeContext: Astarion believes you're plotting to take over the city

290.speaker: Player
290.text: I'm sorry I kind of disappeared. I didn't mean to leave you like that.

286.speaker: Astarion
286.text: Oh my dear, you didn't leave me - I let you go.

182.speaker: Astarion
182.text: If I'd wanted you to stay I only had to say the word and you would have been back by my side. But I'm not some controlling monster.

255.speaker: Astarion
255.text: I wanted to give you space to see what else is out there, make your own mistakes, and return to me ready to fully appreciate our life together.

214.speaker: Astarion
214.text: Anyway, I have had more than enough to keep me busy while you were off gallivanting in another plane.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Really? What's kept you so busy?

82.speaker: Player
82.text: I take it you've been having fun, then?

236.speaker: Astarion
236.text: Ha! Oh bless you, but no. I am living a life better than most can dream of - I'm not trading these silks for scorched rags.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: It's been tough, but at least I'm there with Karlach.

207.speaker: Astarion
207.text: Yes, if anyone can laugh in the face of damnation, she certainly can. You are lucky to have her.

180.speaker: Player
180.text: As 'darling' as a living nightmare can be.

90.speaker: Astarion
90.text: Oh, don't spoil the mood. We're here to have a good time, after all - reminiscing with old friends.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: Despite myself, I did miss you.

341.speaker: Astarion
341.text: The feeling is extremely mutual, my dear. This plane is so very dull without you.

8.speaker: Astarion
8.text: At least I assume it's you in there. You squids all look basically the same.
8.context: NodeContext: Astarion believes you're plotting to take over the city

229.speaker: Astarion
229.text: So tell me, what have you been doing since this travesty?
229.context: NodeContext: Astarion believes you're plotting to take over the city

193.speaker: Player
193.text: I have been working with the Emperor to forward our goals. You need not ask what they are.
193.context: NodeContext: Astarion believes you're plotting to take over the city

25.speaker: Astarion
25.text: Of course not. I'm sure you only want what's best for Baldur's Gate, after all.
25.context: NodeContext: Astarion believes you're plotting to take over the city

83.speaker: Astarion
83.context: NodeContext: Astarion is absolutely plotting to take over the city

305.speaker: Player
305.text: How have you fared since we last met?

337.speaker: Player
337.text: What of you? Have you continued to drink the blood of the living?

165.speaker: Player
165.text: I should speak to the others. Excuse me.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: The Emperor and I reformed the Knights of the Shield. It is now a formidable force.

130.speaker: Astarion
130.text: A purely selfless act, I'm sure. After all, you only want what's best for Baldur's Gate.

162.speaker: Player
162.text: I have adjusted to my new form - come to enjoy it, even.

77.speaker: Astarion
77.text: Really? Really? Gods, people will accept anything...

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Acceptable, but I still think of you sometimes.

112.speaker: Astarion
112.text: I hope you're not expecting me to say it back, because... well.
112.context: NodeContext: He hasn't given the player a single thought.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: I have missed our time together.

224.speaker: Player
224.text: I admit, it has not been easy.

98.speaker: Astarion
98.text: No, I imagine not. What with your face and all...

138.speaker: Astarion
138.text: But, you did save the city. That has to count for... something?

43.speaker: Astarion
43.text: So, you really did it - you became a god. It almost makes my ascension look trivial.
43.context: NodeContext: (Previous line: "Well, look who it is!")

179.speaker: Astarion
179.text: You must love it - all that power at your fingertips? All those followers, worshipping you?

241.speaker: Player
241.text: The perks of divinity are beyond compare. I haven't regretted my choice for a moment.

169.speaker: Player
169.text: Somewhat, but there are times I miss my mortal life.

248.speaker: Astarion
248.text: You can't be serious. You miss being weak? Falling ill? Ageing?

150.speaker: Astarion
150.text: We can be honest with each other, Gale - one immortal being to another: this is great.
150.context: NodeContext: "this is great" as if confiding a secret

211.speaker: Player
211.text: I am surprised you aren't among my followers. I am the God of Ambition, after all.
211.context: NodeContext: Gently teasing God Gale, but Astarion's a little jealous

119.speaker: Astarion
119.text: A god after my own heart, but I am more than happy with my ambitions. And I'm sure they will only grow.
119.context: NodeContext: Gently teasing God Gale, but Astarion's a little jealous

170.speaker: Astarion
170.text: I am a little surprised you came, I thought this plane would bore a god. All these petty mortals and their mayfly lives.
170.context: NodeContext: Gently teasing God Gale, but Astarion's a little jealous

254.speaker: Astarion
254.text: But I suppose we should be grateful you blessed us with your presence. Praise be.
254.context: NodeContext: Gently teasing God Gale, but Astarion's a little jealous

32.speaker: Player
32.text: So, what have you been doing since I saw you last?
32.context: NodeContext: If the player was the Dark Urge

142.speaker: Player
142.text: You seem to be enjoying your new life?
142.context: NodeContext: If the player was the Dark Urge

293.speaker: Astarion
293.text: Of course! I've tried to taste everything this world has to offer.
293.context: NodeContext: If the player was the Dark Urge

95.speaker: Astarion
95.text: Well, not this world, exactly, but a world.
95.context: NodeContext: If the player was the Dark Urge

145.speaker: Astarion
145.text: Can't you tell? Karlach and I have been traversing the Hells.
145.context: NodeContext: If the player was the Dark Urge

71.speaker: Astarion
71.text: I do miss the luxuries this plane has to offer, but I must say - Avernus is second to none when it comes to bloodshed.
71.context: NodeContext: If the player was the Dark Urge

270.speaker: Astarion
270.text: I can slaughter legions of beasts down there and there's always another one just over the horizon.
270.context: NodeContext: If the player was the Dark Urge

156.speaker: Player
156.context: NodeContext: If the player was the Dark Urge

280.speaker: Astarion
280.text: It has been an experience. And a rather wonderful one at that.

70.speaker: Player
70.context: NodeContext: If the player was the Dark Urge

238.speaker: Astarion
238.text: Awful? It's wonderful! We can kill as much as we like and damn the consequences.

53.speaker: Astarion
53.text: It will grow tiresome eventually, but I hope we can find something to fix darling Karlach's engine before then.

189.speaker: Player
189.text: Seems like a place only a psychopath would love.
189.context: NodeContext: If the player was the Dark Urge

309.speaker: Astarion
309.text: You wound me. A little bloodlust doth not a psychopath make.
309.context: NodeContext: If the player was the Dark Urge

265.speaker: Astarion
265.text: You should know that better than anyone.
265.context: NodeContext: If the player was the Dark Urge

188.speaker: Astarion
188.text: Anyway, I imagine the killing will grow tiresome in time. Hopefully then we can return to Faerûn and start building a base of power through fear and manipulation.

40.speaker: Astarion
40.text: It has been a joy! I've been rediscovering what it means to be alive - more or less.
40.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is cute and nieve

61.speaker: Astarion
61.text: I've been out seeing the world, visiting cities charming dignitaries, and making friends up and down the Sword Coast.
61.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is cute and nieve

268.speaker: Astarion
268.text: I'm spinning my web. Power grows slowly, but I have nothing but time now.
268.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is cute and nieve

235.speaker: Player
235.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is cute and nieve

257.speaker: Astarion
257.text: Rather wonderfully, actually. I have been making all sorts of new friends.
257.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is cute and nieve

52.speaker: Astarion
52.text: They're the kinds of friends that would see me burn the first chance they get, but that's all in the nature of the game, isn't it?
52.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is cute and nieve

295.speaker: Astarion
295.text: But the important thing is I am doing wonderfully. Finally having a life that's worth living.
295.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is cute and nieve

124.speaker: Astarion
124.text: And who knows what's next? There is an entire world out there, ready for the taking.
124.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is cute and nieve

194.speaker: Player
194.text: Just don't do anything too drastic while I'm away? I don't want to miss out.
194.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is cute and nieve

332.speaker: Astarion
332.text: I make no promises, but I shall try. Bloodshed is always more fun with company, after all.

128.speaker: Player
128.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is cute and nieve

50.speaker: Player
50.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is cute and nieve

120.speaker: Astarion
120.text: Perhaps the next time we meet, we'll have grander conquests to toast.

342.speaker: Player
342.text: It seems like you're living a good life. I'm glad for you, fangs.
342.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is cute and nieve

253.speaker: Player
253.text: You have ambition. Take care not to confuse it with arrogance.
253.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is cute and nieve

289.speaker: Player
289.text: It is not for me to deny you - enjoy yourself while you can. My Lady shall come to collect, in the end.
289.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is cute and nieve

164.speaker: Player
164.text: More worlds than Toril, even, if you're ambitious enough.
164.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is cute and nieve

110.speaker: Player
110.text: That there is. And the more I see of it, the more I seek to conquer it.
110.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is cute and nieve

132.speaker: Player
132.text: The Vampire Ascendant ruling the world? That's an ambition worthy of my patronage...
132.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is cute and nieve

89.speaker: Player
89.text: Indeed there is. And we're better placed than most to take it.
89.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is cute and nieve

84.speaker: Astarion
84.text: You see, this is why I always liked you. You can see the big picture - what needs to be done.

104.speaker: Astarion
104.text: I did miss you, you know. There is a sense of loneliness that comes with power.

22.speaker: Astarion
22.text: But there'll be more than enough time to catch up once you're done playing hero.

59.speaker: Astarion
59.text: So go - enjoy the party, then get back to burning your path across the planes.

294.speaker: Astarion
294.text: And once you're done, you'll return to take your place at my side. And this world will tremble before us.

220.speaker: Astarion
220.text: We did share a wonderful adventure, you and I. A pity to see it end, in some ways.

299.speaker: Astarion
299.text: But we have great new lives stretching out before us. And great new adventures to go on.

314.speaker: Astarion
314.text: I will never forget the time we spent together, though. And I know you'll never forget me.

276.speaker: Player
276.text: I'm going to take it, but I'll do it my way.
276.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is cute and nieve

250.speaker: Player
250.text: There are more worlds out there than you can know.
250.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is cute and nieve

7.speaker: Player
7.text: I've heard my followers express the same desire. They'll do their best to stop you...
7.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is cute and nieve

125.speaker: Astarion
125.text: Ha! Oh they are welcome to try. I could use a new trophy for my wall.

154.speaker: Astarion
154.text: I did miss you, you know. You always had such unique ideas about the world.

225.speaker: Player
225.text: Evil never lasts. Someone will stop you.
225.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is cute and nieve

139.speaker: Player
139.text: Evil never lasts. Someone will stop you.
139.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is cute and nieve

178.speaker: Player
178.text: If you try to consume the world, the world may in fact consume you.
178.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is cute and nieve

33.speaker: Player
33.text: You can never truly take the world - only paw at it. This is all Lady Shar's prize.
33.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is cute and nieve

278.speaker: Astarion
278.text: I appreciate your candour. Even if you couldn't be more wrong.
278.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is cute and nieve

335.speaker: Astarion
335.text: You know, I did miss you - you were never afraid to stand up to me. Now almost everyone is.

219.speaker: Player
219.text: Tread carefully, or I'll toss you on the pile of demons I've slaughtered.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Make no mistake - I will destroy you if you put Baldur's Gate in danger.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: Become a monster, and I'll destroy you as I have so many others.

199.speaker: Player
199.text: This world isn't yours for the taking, Astarion. Did the Absolute's rise and fall teach you nothing?

177.speaker: Player
177.text: Toril belongs to all of us. I bow to no one - and most certainly not to you.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I admire your ambition, even if it is rather... obvious.

176.speaker: Player
176.text: A world far too precious for it to be punctured by your ambitions. You aren't taking anything.

345.speaker: Player
345.text: Pathetic. You sound worse than my Father.

344.speaker: Player
344.text: You are not the only one here with ambitions. It would be a pity if we came into conflict.

155.speaker: Player
155.text: That sounds like something Cazador would say.

200.speaker: Astarion
200.text: Try to wound me all you like, but I'm so much better than he ever was.

118.speaker: Astarion
118.text: I achieved what he only dreamed about. And now my ambitions can take me anywhere I want.

195.speaker: Player
195.text: I'm well aware of your 'web', but Baldur's Gate is under my protection.

1.speaker: Astarion
1.text: Oh my boy, don't be like that - the Gate is more than big enough for us both.

74.speaker: Astarion
74.text: Anyway, it's not like Baldur's Gate is the only city in Faerûn. I have plenty of options.

113.speaker: Player
113.text: What's your end game? Ruler of Baldur's Gate?

27.speaker: Player
27.text: What's your end game, Astarion - ruler of Baldur's Gate? I would never let it happen.

141.speaker: Astarion
141.text: Oh I wouldn't say 'ruler', any old fool can sit on a throne. I would be more of a... puppet master?

3.speaker: Astarion
3.text: For all my freedom to walk in the sun, it's still much more fun to pull the strings of power from the shadows.

102.speaker: Astarion
102.text: Not that everyone's on board, of course. Our friend Wyll is a stubbornly capable Grand Duke. It's been difficult to get much past him, although I will keep trying.

227.speaker: Astarion
227.text: Cazador's mansion has become my palace and played host to every kind of banquet, soiree, and masquerade imaginable.

302.speaker: Astarion
302.text: And of course has seen its fair share of hedonism, clandestine deals, and the occasional disappearance. Whatever it takes to build up my influence over those who matter.

231.speaker: Player
231.text: I should go and talk to the others.

127.speaker: Astarion
127.text: If you'd rather waste your time with them, you're entirely welcome to.

20.speaker: Astarion
20.text: But not to worry, I'm sure our paths will cross again.

171.speaker: Astarion
171.text: It's an honour, standing before the most famous wizard in the lands.
171.context: NodeContext: (Previous line: "Well, look who it is!")

57.speaker: Astarion
57.text: You could have been a god, but I suppose 'wizard' will do.

133.speaker: Player
133.text: Not just a wizard - Professor Gale Dekarios of Blackstaff Academy, at your service.

151.speaker: Astarion
151.text: You finally found a place where you could talk all day and everyone had to listen to you? You must be elated.

279.speaker: Astarion
279.text: No, power isn't everything. But it is an awful lot of fun.

92.speaker: Astarion
92.text: Don't get me wrong, darling, you are quite the wizard. Even Elminster's in your shadow now.

48.speaker: Astarion
48.text: I admit, I did expect you to be a little bitter about missing out on godhood. But instead you look... happy. And you wear it well.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: Divinity would have been nice, it's true...

37.speaker: Astarion
37.text: But look on the bright side - your life is yours to live. You're not bound to answer prayers or appear in visions or - whatever else gods do.

29.speaker: Astarion
29.text: You may be mortal, but you look... well, happy. And you wear it rather well.

168.speaker: Player
168.text: I did what felt right. Did you, when you chose to become the 'Vampire Ascendant'?

21.speaker: Astarion
21.text: Of course I did - look at me! I have it all - power, riches, influence. What more could I want?

0.speaker: Player
0.text: You're happy, then? You think you made the right choice?

306.speaker: Player
306.text: Forget I said anything. How have you been?

196.speaker: Astarion
196.text: Or... projected? Honestly, if I'd known this was an option, I would have stayed at home too.
196.context: NodeContext: (Previous line: "Well, look who it is!")  The person Astarion's speaking to appears as a hologram.

190.speaker: Player
190.text: I'm sorry I just disappeared. I didn't mean to leave you like that.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: I've taken a breather in Limbo with Lae'zel, after myriad battles in the Astral Plane.

233.speaker: Astarion
233.text: Oh yes, the war! Forgive me, it slipped my mind entirely.

184.speaker: Player
184.text: I've taken a breather in Limbo, after myriad battles in the Astral Plane.

272.speaker: Player
272.text: I would prefer to be there in person. It is good to see you.

122.speaker: Astarion
122.text: It's good to see you too. A pity we can't share a drink, it's been too long, darling.

31.speaker: Astarion
31.text: I have been rather busy, you see. I'm now a man of power and influence - it doesn't leave much time for indulging in treats like this.

262.speaker: Player
262.text: This projected form is adequate. Unless you missed my scent, istik?

259.speaker: Astarion
259.text: Well... Maybe a little. But I'm not complaining - anything that means I get to see my old friends again.

54.speaker: Astarion
54.text: I wasn't sure you'd want to stay on our humble plane. You haven't gone native, have you?
54.context: NodeContext: (Previous line: "Well, look who it is!")

68.speaker: Player
68.text: I stayed for love. I do not regret it.

260.speaker: Astarion
260.text: Oh, been indulging your appetite, have you? So have I, as it happens.

258.speaker: Astarion
258.text: You should visit some time. Now that I'm a man of influence, I'm sure we could satisfy any cravings you had.

172.speaker: Player
172.text: I enjoyed my time in Baldur's Gate. It gave me a taste for more.

203.speaker: Player
203.text: I have come to like this planet. And even some of its people.

114.speaker: Astarion
114.text: Esteemed company included, I'm sure. I am a man of influence now, after all.

271.speaker: Player
271.text: It's good to see you too.

228.speaker: Astarion
228.text: Lae'zel, was that... a joke? Do you need to lie down?

329.speaker: Astarion
329.text: If you need a place to recuperate, you're more than welcome to visit my palace. It is rather decadent, you know.

103.speaker: Astarion
103.text: The matriarch of the Sharran temple herself! I'm honoured, your Lossness.
103.context:
CinematicNodeContext: With a teasing flourish/bowNodeContext: Speaking to Shadowheart - who's leading the church of Shar [With a teasing flourish/bow]
(Previous line: "Well, look who it is!")

181.speaker: Astarion
181.text: I am a little surprised, I wasn't sure you'd come walk among us who have so much.
181.context: NodeContext: Mostly to himself - he's jealous of Gale-that's-become-a-God

78.speaker: Player
78.text: Some things are worth remembering. Celebrating, even.
78.context: NodeContext: Mostly to himself - he's jealous of Gale-that's-become-a-God

187.speaker: Astarion
187.text: That doesn't sound especially Sharran of you. But what do I know - I never had much time for gods.
187.context: NodeContext: Mostly to himself - he's jealous of Gale-that's-become-a-God

251.speaker: Astarion
251.text: Even if we knew them when they were mere mortals, Gale...
251.context: NodeContext: Mostly to himself - he's jealous of Gale-that's-become-a-God

88.speaker: Astarion
88.text: But this is not the night to split hairs. It's a night to celebrate our past and toast our future.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: Perhaps I missed you, despite myself.

15.speaker: Astarion
15.text: Well of course you did, my sweet. Who wouldn't miss such esteemed company?

123.speaker: Player
123.text: I am here to see the others. Not you.

100.speaker: Astarion
100.text: You wound me - I thought we had something. Two kindred spirits with shared interests in darkness and grief.

63.speaker: Astarion
63.text: That time locked away in your temple has done you no favours, darling. I've been out in the world, living, and look at me now!

36.speaker: Astarion
36.text: Shar's greatest apostate. Although you seem to be doing rather well without 'the Lady'.
36.context: NodeContext: (Previous line: "Well, look who it is!")

274.speaker: Player
274.text: I am - I've been getting to know my parents.

336.speaker: Astarion
336.text: Oh yes? Good for you. I'm sure it's been very emotional and... good.

282.speaker: Astarion
282.text: It's just not especially interesting, that's all. I was really hoping for some sex or violence. You know: something fun.

324.speaker: Player
324.text: I've been healing. Learning. Finding my place in the world.

263.speaker: Player
263.text: I'm my own person now. It feels wonderful.

327.speaker: Astarion
327.text: Yes, that's the spirit! Claiming your place in the world - not letting anyone stand in your way. We're two of a kind, really.

185.speaker: Player
185.text: And you seem as terrible as ever.

158.speaker: Astarion
158.text: Oh my sweet, so good of you to notice.

269.speaker: Astarion
269.text: I've been living, you see. Sampling every titillation and vice this world has to offer. And it offers a lot.

292.speaker: Astarion
292.text: The Grand Duke himself! Come to walk amongst the plebs?
292.context: NodeContext: (Previous line: "Well, look who it is!")

46.speaker: Player
46.text: I'm here as 'Old Friend' Wyll, not 'Grand Duke' Wyll.

73.speaker: Astarion
73.text: You're a man of power now, Wyll. However you introduce yourself, you will always be the Grand Duke.

343.speaker: Astarion
343.text: People like us cannot just put on and cast aside the trappings of power. We're special, you and I.

315.speaker: Player
315.text: You're hardly a pleb, Astarion. You have a palace in the Gate.

301.speaker: Astarion
301.text: Well, yes, I suppose I am rather special. I've become a man of some influence since we last spent any quality time together.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: I could say the same - I haven't seen you walking the streets recently.

325.speaker: Astarion
325.text: Well no, I have had a busy schedule. I've been mixing with Baldur's Gate highest society, after all. Making connections, gaining influence - finding my place in this beautiful city of yours.

109.speaker: Astarion
109.text: The Blade of Avernus, fresh from the Hells. And how are you enjoying your infernal crusade?
109.context: NodeContext: (Previous line: "Well, look who it is!")

146.speaker: Player
146.text: I've had to walk a delicate path, killing devils while keeping Mizora on my side.

121.speaker: Astarion
121.text: Alas, not every deal with a devil works out as well as it did for me.

264.speaker: Player
264.text: Now that I'm free of my pact, I've made the Hells tremble.

284.speaker: Astarion
284.text: Oh, that is excellent! I had hoped you would cause a little chaos down there. And some carnage to boot by the sounds of it.

334.speaker: Player
334.text: It's every bit as enjoyable as it sounds.

135.speaker: Astarion
135.text: Well, it sounds very enjoyable to me, so I trust you're having a darling time.

147.speaker: Player
147.text: Killing devils is going well. Although I'm not above killing dangerous vampires too.

340.speaker: Astarion
340.text: Well, I shall be sure to let you know if I spot any.

298.speaker: Astarion
298.text: Thankfully we're just two good friends, reminiscing and enjoying life.

96.speaker: Astarion
96.text: The Blade of Frontiers, famed for protecting the weak and slaying monsters. I hope you don't think either will be necessary tonight.
96.context: NodeContext: (Previous line: "Well, look who it is!")

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Not as long as you behave, no.

204.speaker: Astarion
204.text: Please, when have I ever behaved?

202.speaker: Player
202.text: I'm not sure. Are you feeling especially weak?

117.speaker: Astarion
117.text: Ha! Oh no, my boy. I haven't felt weak in a long, long time.

239.speaker: Player
239.text: I missed you. You were always good for a laugh on a long trail.

5.speaker: Astarion
5.text: The feeling is very mutual. Even if I was laughing behind your back.

16.speaker: Astarion
16.text: But I am glad you came - and I genuinely mean that. An evening like this would not be the same without you.

313.speaker: Astarion
313.text: My murderous little friend! What have you been up to? Fallen back into old habits?
313.context: NodeContext: (Previous line: "Well, look who it is!") Addressing the Dark Urge, so "old habits" means "murder"

131.speaker: Player
131.text: No, the urges have passed. I'm my own person again.

97.speaker: Astarion
97.text: Well, that's a relief. I didn't want to ruin a perfectly good evening by having to kill you.

212.speaker: Astarion
212.text: Never mind a perfectly good set of clothes. This cloth stains at the slightest drop of blood. It's awful.

234.speaker: Player
234.text: I've been trying to relax - lots of herbal tea and breathing exercises.

303.speaker: Player
303.text: Researching Bhaalspawn. I want to know everything I can about what happened to me.

28.speaker: Astarion
28.text: Ah, a sensible pastime indeed. You must tell me all about it sometime. I'm sure I'd find it fascinating.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: Thinking about taking over the world. But this time doing it my way.

93.speaker: Astarion
93.text: Ah, a mutual interest! You must tell me all about it sometime - if only to make sure our plans don't clash.

333.speaker: Astarion
333.text: My first and oldest friend. The last six months have been kind to you.
333.context: NodeContext: (Previous line: "Well, look who it is!")

287.speaker: Player
287.text: You can thank my other half for that. Being with them has been a blessing.
287.context: NodeContext: At some point, the player dumped Astarion to be with their current partner

312.speaker: Astarion
312.text: A blessing, no less? Well isn't that just darling?
312.context: NodeContext: At some point, the player dumped Astarion to be with their current partner

183.speaker: Astarion
183.text: A pity that you let the real blessing slip through your fingers, of course. Though we all make mistakes.
183.context: NodeContext: At some point, the player dumped Astarion to be with their current partner

338.speaker: Player
338.text: I've tried to live a good life since we last met.
338.context: NodeContext: At some point, the player dumped Astarion to be with their current partner

87.speaker: Astarion
87.text: Gods, really? Well, if that's what tickles you, I suppose.
87.context: NodeContext: At some point, the player dumped Astarion to be with their current partner

192.speaker: Astarion
192.text: But I am glad to see you're living life to the fullest. We deserve nothing less, you and I.
192.context: NodeContext: At some point, the player dumped Astarion to be with their current partner

273.speaker: Player
273.text: They have! I've indulged every vice I had and discovered some new ones.

218.speaker: Astarion
218.text: A soul after my own heart! Assuming you have any soul left, of course.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: It's been excellent - I've been seeing the world.

277.speaker: Astarion
277.text: Ah, travelling far and wide, seeing all this world has to offer. A fine life indeed.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Not as kind as they've been to you.

319.speaker: Astarion
319.text: I admit, since my ascension it's been a charmed existence. Everything I ever wanted is right at my fingertips.

152.speaker: Astarion
152.text: We've already had one heart-to-heart - best to leave it at that, don't you think? I'm not sure I can manage another bout of sentimentality.

161.speaker: Astarion
161.text: I'm flattered by the attention, darling, but don't you want to check in with some of our erstwhile companions? I'm sure they've missed you.

167.speaker: Astarion
167.text: You can't want to go already. Enjoy tonight, celebrate with our sweet friends.

44.speaker: Astarion
44.text: And when you're done, we can get back to enjoying forever together.

173.speaker: Astarion
173.text: We have eternity for chit-chat, my love - the others only get you for tonight. I can't keep you all to myself.

226.speaker: Astarion
226.text: We have eternity for chit-chat, my love - the others only get you for tonight. I can't keep you all to myself.
